docs.abstract: Community health workers can support, guide and encourage patients to manage their health over the long term.

docs.lead_paragraph: Longtime Google Inc executive Megan Smith is a top candidate for the role of United States' chief technology officer, Bloomberg reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Google's Megan Smith Considered Top Choice for U.S. Technology Chief: Bloomberg
headline.print_headline: Google's Megan Smith Considered Top Choice for U.S. Technology Chief: Bloomberg

docs.snippet: Longtime Google Inc executive Megan Smith is a top candidate for the role of United States' chief technology officer, Bloomberg reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

docs.lead_paragraph: A half-million more low-income Pennsylvanians are in line to get federally funded health insurance after the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services on Thursday approved the state's plan to accept Medicaid expansion money under the landmark 2010 federal health care law.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Becomes 27th State to Expand Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Becomes 27th State to Expand Medicaid

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal officials have reached an agreement with Pennsylvania Gov. Tom Corbett over his plan to use federal funds to pay for private health insurance coverage for up to 600,000 residents, the governor said on Thursday.

headline.main: U.S. Officials Reach Deal With Pennsylvania on Medicaid
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Reach Deal With Pennsylvania on Medicaid

docs.snippet: Federal officials have reached an agreement with Pennsylvania Gov. Tom Corbett over his plan to use federal funds to pay for private health insurance coverage for up to 600,000 residents, the governor said on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge reinstated a doctor's license Thursday, a month after it was suspended when health officials accused his clinic of unsanitary conditions and reusing needles.

headline.main: Court Overturns Suspension of W.Va. Doc's License
headline.print_headline: Court Overturns Suspension of W.Va. Doc's License

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House announced on Thursday that Todd Park, a technology and innovation policy adviser to President Barack Obama, is relocating to California to advise the president on technology from there.

headline.main: White House Says Technology Policy Aide Park to Take New Role
headline.print_headline: White House Says Technology Policy Aide Park to Take New Role

docs.snippet: The White House announced on Thursday that Todd Park, a technology and innovation policy adviser to President Barack Obama, is relocating to California to advise the president on technology from there.

headline.main: Today in Small Business: Independent Contractors

docs.abstract: Thanks to protesting workers, the president of a family supermarket gets his job back. Section 179 deductions are changing. Do you recline in your airline seat?

docs.lead_paragraph: The Ebola epidemic in West Africa could infect over 20,000 people and spread to more countries, the U.N. health agency said on Thursday, warning that an international effort costing almost half a billion dollars is needed to overcome the outbreak.

headline.main: West Africa Ebola Outbreak Could Infect 20,000 People, WHO Says
headline.print_headline: West Africa Ebola Outbreak Could Infect 20,000 People, WHO Says

docs.snippet: The Ebola epidemic in West Africa could infect over 20,000 people and spread to more countries, the U.N. health agency said on Thursday, warning that an international effort costing almost half a billion dollars is needed to overcome the outbreak.

docs.lead_paragraph: A doctor in Nigeria's oil hub of Port Harcourt has died from Ebola after treating a contact of a Liberian-American man who was the first recorded case of the virus in Africa's most populous country, the Health Ministry said on Thursday.

headline.main: Doctor Dies of Ebola in Nigeria's Oil Hub Port Harcourt
headline.print_headline: Doctor Dies of Ebola in Nigeria's Oil Hub Port Harcourt

docs.snippet: A doctor in Nigeria's oil hub of Port Harcourt has died from Ebola after treating a contact of a Liberian-American man who was the first recorded case of the virus in Africa's most populous country, the Health Ministry said on Thursday.
